name: The History of Canadian-U.S. Relations
description: Over time, Canadians and Americans have developed distinct identities and cultures, but their histories have always been closely linked. This course examines the complex interrelationship between Canada and the United States. from the colonial period through the present day, especially its political, cultural, and indigenous dimensions.
prerequisites: 0.5 FCE in a CDN course or permission of instructor
exclusions: CDN305H1 (Canadian Topics II: The History of Canadian-U.S. Relations)
